about_the_game:
"NARRENSCHIFF" is a horror puzzle game set in the 1980s, featuring a vintage pixel and pencil-drawn art style.

The story takes place in a fictional authoritarian country in Europe.

You'll play as Wayde Othman, a data entry officer from the Environmental Bureau,

embarking on an adventure in a nearly abandoned mental hospital.

Your goal is to uncover your lost memories and unravel the massive conspiracy brewing within.

+++

Drawing inspiration from sci-fi novels "Solaris" and "The South Reach,"
you'll experience mysterious phenomena beyond scientific explanation,
intertwined between memories and reality, offering you a unique adventure!

+++

In this game, you'll experience the following elements commonly found in traditional RPG Maker games:

· Intricately designed puzzle-solving, gradually uncovering the world's lore and the truth behind the mental hospital.

· A narrative-driven experience akin to a visual novel, creating intimate memories with story characters.

· Intense and thrilling chase sequences, escaping the clutches of monsters.

· Enjoy emotionally impactful background music composed by musician Musuii!

short_description: "NARRENSCHIFF" is a psychological horror puzzle game. Players take on the role of an amnesiac man who awakens in a mysterious mental hospital. As they explore, they unravel a story involving their own origins and the conspiracy brewing within the walls of the mental institution.
